subject: Programming
title: When to Use What
description: Learn When to Use What in one minute.

hook.text: Need fast lookup by key? Hash table. Need sorted order? Tree. Need FIFO? Queue. Match the need.

buildup.text: Each data structure excels at specific operations and struggles with others. Know the tradeoffs.

discovery.text: Arrays for indexed access. Linked lists for frequent insertions. Heaps for priority. Graphs for relationships.

twist.text: Real systems often combine multiple structures. A database uses B-Trees, hash tables, and queues together.

climax.text: The skill isn't knowing every structure. It's knowing which question to ask about your data.

punchline.text: The right structure solves half the problem.

quiz.question: How do you choose the right data structure?
options: Match the structure to your most common operation
Pick the newest data structure available
